cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast, with the center forecast to cross the coast near Corpus Christi then drift into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Port Mansfield and Corpus Christi, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for upper Texas coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mesquite Bay to High Island, TX (includes Galveston Bay area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast from Sargent to High Island, including Houston–Galveston region, mainly by rain bands and elevated surf
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions possible; only a 2–3 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in Galveston Bay; no official surge warning for the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain possible in the Houston-Galveston area with locally higher amounts, posing flash-flood risk in low-lying terminal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents along ship channel approaches; isolated tornadoes within outer rain bands cannot be ruled out
